alert.note: Alert for Independence; Jackson; Lawrence (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:52AM CST until further notice by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Black River At Pocahontas affecting Randolph County. Black River At Black Rock affecting Jackson, Independence and Lawrence Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Black River At Black Rock. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Agricultural land is flooding along both banks of the river in Lawrence, Independence, and Jackson counties. Minor flooding in Powhatan Community and Courthouse State Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Monday the stage was 18.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CST Monday was 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting near 18.9 feet and will fall below flood stage by Tuesday evening January 11. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.9 feet on 05/28/2000. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecast 12 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Crest Time Date Black River Black Rock 14.0 18.9 Mon 10 AM 18.6 17.5 16.3 *CRESTING* &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
